claims.statement: Healthy hepatocyte de novo GSH synthesis is ~0.3-0.5 umol/g liver/hr (~10-18 umol/g/day), yielding ~15-27 mmol/day whole-liver capacity. Compromised liver (NAFLD/alcohol) reduces this by 2-4x.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It specifies a concrete quantitative threshold (<2x variation) measurable in GSH turnover flux studies.
claims.feasible_reason: Direct measurements in healthy and NAFLD hepatocytes use standard isotopic labeling or enzymatic assays in primary cell culture.
claims.novel_reason: Enables quantitative comparison of GSH buffering in healthy vs. compromised livers to predict CBD safety margins.

claims.statement: At 50mg oral CBD/day, peak portal CBD concentration is ~0.5-2 uM, yielding VDAC1 fractional occupancy of ~4-15% (using Kd=11 uM). This generates ROS load well within the 24hr GSH regeneration budget (consuming <5% of daily synthesis capacity in healthy liver).
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by PK data showing portal CBD >5 uM or hepatic GSH depletion >10% at 50mg dose.
claims.feasible_reason: Requires human portal vein sampling or advanced in vivo PK imaging not standard in basic labs.
claims.novel_reason: Anchors prediction of ROS load vs. GSH budget for chronic dosing safety hypothesis.

claims.statement: CBD-VDAC1 binding is reversible on timescales of 1-4 hours based on lipophilic ligand-membrane protein kinetics; allosteric gating perturbation resets upon dissociation without persistent conformational memory.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by electrophysiology showing persistent gating post-washout or evidence of modification.
claims.feasible_reason: Standard bilayer reconstitution or patch-clamp assays test washout recovery in isolated mitochondria.
claims.novel_reason: Tests reversibility timescale critical for assessing cumulative VDAC dysfunction in chronic dosing.

claims.statement: 7-OH-CBD accumulation at steady-state (50mg/day) may increase effective VDAC occupancy window by 30-60%, but total combined occupancy remains below levels causing net GSH depletion in healthy liver.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by 7-OH-CBD Kd <3 uM or steady-state levels exceeding parent.
claims.feasible_reason: Steady-state hepatic 7-OH-CBD requires chronic dosing PK studies beyond standard cell culture.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies metabolite contribution to widen occupancy window in chronic exposure model.

claims.statement: The null hypothesis (progressive GSH depletion at 50mg/day in healthy liver) is likely defeated. The safety margin is ~5-10x for GSH flux but narrows to ~2-3x in compromised liver.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by longitudinal data showing GSH/GSSG decline or ALT rise over months.
claims.feasible_reason: Requires 3-6 month clinical trials or serial biopsies in humans/animals, not standard lab methods.
claims.novel_reason: Synthesizes safety margin narrowing in compromised liver for risk stratification.

claims.statement: Healthy human hepatocytes synthesize GSH at 0.5–1.2 μmol/g liver/hr, but this drops >2x in NAFLD/alcohol-related liver disease due to limited cysteine availability and ATP depletion.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by direct GCL activity/GSH flux measurements in healthy vs. diseased biopsies.
claims.feasible_reason: Standard enzymatic assays and flux analysis in primary human hepatocytes or biopsies.
claims.novel_reason: Links ATP/cysteine limitation to >2x synthesis drop, enabling compromised liver vulnerability tests.

claims.statement: At 50mg oral CBD/day (6–19% bioavailability), the daily ROS load exceeds 24hr GSH regeneration capacity in metabolically compromised livers, but not in healthy livers, assuming a safety margin of 2–5x.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by longitudinal GSH/GSSG in biopsies from healthy/NAFLD on chronic CBD.
claims.feasible_reason: Needs 4+ week dosing with liver biopsies, beyond standard cell/in vitro protocols.
claims.novel_reason: Predicts ROS saturation specifically in compromised livers vs. healthy.

claims.statement: CBD-VDAC1 binding is reversible within 12–24 hr, but allosteric gating perturbations (e.g., proton leak) may persist for hours post-dissociation, narrowing the safety margin.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by time-resolved patch-clamp showing no gating recovery post-washout.
claims.feasible_reason: Patch-clamp on isolated mitochondria tests conductance recovery kinetics.
claims.novel_reason: Distinguishes dissociation timescale from persistent allosteric effects on safety margin.

claims.statement: 7-OH-CBD accumulates to 2–5x parent CBD levels at steady-state (50mg/day), contributing meaningful VDAC occupancy due to slower clearance and comparable affinity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by steady-state 7-OH-CBD levels or VDAC occupancy assays.
claims.feasible_reason: Chronic dosing PK and hepatic homogenate assays require animal models, not standard.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies 2-5x accumulation impact on VDAC occupancy for steady-state hypothesis.

claims.statement: Chronic sub-threshold CBD dosing causes cumulative ATP deficit independent of ROS/GSH status, due to persistent VDAC-mediated proton leak.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by ATP/ADP ratios in chronic-dosed mitochondria with ROS/GSH clamped.
claims.feasible_reason: Longitudinal animal dosing with clamp agents exceeds standard lab cell culture.
claims.novel_reason: Proposes independent ATP deficit pathway decoupled from ROS for chronic load testing.

claims.statement: Healthy human hepatocyte GSH synthesis rate is 3-6 μmol/g liver/hr (total liver ~5-10 mmol/day).
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by primary hepatocyte assays outside 2-8 μmol/g/hr range.
claims.feasible_reason: Standard GSH synthesis assays in cultured human hepatocytes.
claims.novel_reason: Restates GSH rate without advancing CBD-specific chronic load prediction.

claims.statement: Synthesis rate drops >2x (to <2 μmol/g/hr) in NAFLD/hepatitis/alcohol livers due to GCLH downregulation.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by biopsies showing normal rates in diseased livers.
claims.feasible_reason: GCL expression and flux assays in patient-derived hepatocytes or biopsies.
claims.novel_reason: Specifies GCLH downregulation mechanism testable in disease models for CBD risk.

claims.statement: At 50mg/day oral CBD, steady-state hepatic [CBD] ~0.1-0.5μM (plasma 0.05-0.2μM × liver enrichment), VDAC occ <5%, ROS load <<1 μmol/g liver/day (<2% GSH capacity).
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by PK-PD showing hepatic ROS >5% GSH use.
claims.feasible_reason: Human steady-state hepatic ROS measurement requires invasive sampling.
claims.novel_reason: Provides sub-Kd occupancy calculation tying dose to negligible load.

claims.statement: Safety margin >50x (TI>>10) in healthy liver; narrows to ~5-10x in compromised.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by chronic trials showing GSH <80% baseline.
claims.feasible_reason: Chronic human trials for GSH/therapeutic index not feasible in basic lab.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies >50x margin narrowing to 5-10x in compromised livers.

claims.statement: CBD-VDAC1 binding reversible (t_off <<12hr); allosteric gating resets post-dissociation.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by washout electrophysiology showing gating change >1hr.
claims.feasible_reason: Standard VDAC electrophysiology with kinetic analysis post-washout.
claims.novel_reason: Mechanics of reset post-dissociation critical for dosing interval safety.

claims.statement: 7-OH-CBD accumulates 2-5x (t1/2~3x CBD), but [7OH_ss] <0.2μM, negligible VDAC occ (<2%) sans affinity data.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by 7OH-VDAC Kd <10μM plus ss>1μM.
claims.feasible_reason: Steady-state levels need chronic PK, affinity via binding assay feasible but incomplete.
claims.novel_reason: Negligible contribution doesn't advance occupancy expansion hypothesis.

claims.statement: Null defeated: no progressive GSH/VDAC/ATP cumulation at 50mg/day healthy liver.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by serial biopsies showing GSH/VDAC decline over 4wks.
claims.feasible_reason: Serial liver biopsies in chronic dosing not standard lab method.
claims.novel_reason: Defeats null by arguing reversible low-occupancy prevents accumulation.

claims.statement: The *de novo* GSH synthesis rate in a healthy human liver (~2.3 umol/g/hr) is robust, but can be impaired by >50% (>2x difference) in metabolically compromised states like NAFLD, drastically reducing the buffering capacity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by study showing NAFLD rates within 50% of healthy.
claims.feasible_reason: Comparative GSH synthesis in primary hepatocytes from cohorts.
claims.novel_reason: >50% impairment quantifies buffering loss in compromised states.

claims.statement: At 50mg/day, the peak mitochondrial VDAC occupancy in a healthy individual remains far below the toxic threshold, and the resultant ROS load is a minor fraction (<5%) of the liver's daily GSH regeneration capacity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by hepatocyte CBD >5 uM at steady-state via biopsy/imaging.
claims.feasible_reason: Liver biopsy or imaging for steady-state levels not standard.
claims.novel_reason: <5% ROS fraction supports safe chronic dosing in healthy liver.

claims.statement: CBD-VDAC allosteric binding is reversible on a timescale of hours, and the channel's gating function resets upon CBD dissociation, preventing cumulative VDAC dysfunction between standard 12-24 hour dosing intervals.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by patch-clamp showing altered gating post-washout.
claims.feasible_reason: Electrophysiology on CBD-treated mitochondria after washout.
claims.novel_reason: Confirms reset prevents cumulative dysfunction between doses.

claims.statement: At 50 mg oral CBD/day, the estimated peak hepatic portal concentration of CBD + 7-OH-CBD is < 5 μM, which is below the VDAC1 Kd (11 μM) for most of the dosing interval.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by portal concentrations >10 μM in primate model.
claims.feasible_reason: Primate portal vein sampling not standard lab equipment/method.
claims.novel_reason: <5 μM combined peak below Kd anchors low occupancy prediction.

claims.statement: In a healthy liver, daily GSH synthesis capacity (~5-10 μmol/g liver/24h) vastly exceeds the oxidative load from sub-Kd CBD exposure, preventing progressive depletion.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by biopsies showing >40% GSH/GSSG drop in users.
claims.feasible_reason: Chronic user liver biopsies vs. controls require clinical access.
claims.novel_reason: Vast excess capacity prevents depletion under sub-Kd exposure.

claims.statement: 7-OH-CBD accumulation at steady-state does not meaningfully widen the VDAC occupancy window because its concentration remains low and its VDAC1 affinity is unknown but likely weaker than CBD.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by Kd <20 μM and C_min >2 μM data.
claims.feasible_reason: Radioligand binding for affinity feasible; PK less so but partial test possible.
claims.novel_reason: Weaker affinity assumption doesn't enable new occupancy widening test.

claims.statement: The null hypothesis of progressive GSH depletion or cumulative VDAC dysfunction from 50 mg/day in healthy liver is defeated; the primary chronic risk is from pre-existing liver compromise, not cumulative load in healthy tissue.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disprovable by longitudinal ALT/mtDNA rise in healthy subjects.
claims.feasible_reason: 3-month human studies with biomarkers not basic lab feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Shifts risk to pre-existing compromise, defeating cumulative damage null.

recommendation: Lab Gate PASSED with filter. 8/24 claims cleared. 16 filtered: 'At 50mg oral CBD/day, peak portal CBD concentratio...' not feasible; '7-OH-CBD accumulation at steady-state (50mg/day) m...' not feasible; 'The null hypothesis (progressive GSH depletion at ...' not feasible
